<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Provides write only access to a subclass of &#96;WritableBinaryStream&#96;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Provides bounds checking and helpers for writing certain common data types</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="comment">/// such as null-terminated strings, integers in various flavors of endianness,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">/// etc.  Can be subclassed to provide reading and writing of custom datatypes,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">/// although no methods are overridable.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Write the string \\p Str to the underlying stream followed by a null</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// terminator.  On success, updates the offset so that subsequent writes</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// occur at the next unwritten position.  \\p Str need not be null terminated</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// on input.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Write the string \\p Str to the underlying stream without a null</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// terminator.  On success, updates the offset so that subsequent writes</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// occur at the next unwritten position.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns a success error code if the data was successfully written,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// otherwise returns an appropriate error code.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamwriter/#ac9c2dc641243ad8170ac9c0e69545f37">writeFixedString</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Str);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Efficiently reads all data from \\p Ref, and writes it to this stream.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This operation will not invoke any copies of the source data, regardless</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// of the source stream&#39;s implementation.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns a success error code if the data was successfully written,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// otherwise returns an appropriate error code.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamwriter/#aa08601ded5ad31dbdd5a5262a972f479">writeStreamRef</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamref">BinaryStreamRef</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9db8c44b250b90e3ab7e4d144e7c9c2ea60baadb22e80b147e4885ad16760e569">Ref</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Efficiently reads \\p Size bytes from \\p Ref, and writes it to this stream.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This operation will not invoke any copies of the source data, regardless</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// of the source stream&#39;s implementation.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns a success error code if the data was successfully written,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// otherwise returns an appropriate error code.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamwriter/#aa08601ded5ad31dbdd5a5262a972f479">writeStreamRef</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamref">BinaryStreamRef</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9db8c44b250b90e3ab7e4d144e7c9c2ea60baadb22e80b147e4885ad16760e569">Ref</a>, uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Writes the object \\p Obj to the underlying stream, as if by using memcpy.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// It is up to the caller to ensure that type of \\p Obj can be safely copied</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in this fashion, as no checks are made to ensure that this is safe.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns a success error code if the data was successfully written,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// otherwise returns an appropriate error code.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamwriter/#ae73ad246f9f1adc35f0ce49fc089b52a"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> T&gt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamwriter/#ae73ad246f9f1adc35f0ce49fc089b52a">writeObject</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/mips/mips16isellowering-cpp/#a0acb682b8260ab1c60b918599864e2e5">T</a> &amp;Obj) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;assert</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(!std::is&#95;pointer&lt;T&gt;::value,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="normal">                  </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;writeObject should not be used with pointers, to write &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="normal">                  </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;the pointed-to value dereference the pointer before calling &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="normal">                  </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;writeObject&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamwriter/#abb614d7e749a1af26c1d719b28ba4fb7">writeBytes</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;uint8&#95;t&gt;</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">reinterpret&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">uint8&#95;t &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(&amp;Obj), </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">sizeof</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/mips/mips16isellowering-cpp/#a0acb682b8260ab1c60b918599864e2e5">T</a>)));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Writes an array of objects of type T to the underlying stream, as if by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// using memcpy.  It is up to the caller to ensure that type of \\p Obj can</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// be safely copied in this fashion, as no checks are made to ensure that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// this is safe.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns a success error code if the data was successfully written,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// otherwise returns an appropriate error code.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
